quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Patient and Diagnosis
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, frog, throat. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: If a patient has chest pain and ST elevation in nearly all leads of the EKG, what is the likely diagnosis?
The word buck is used for what male animal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: A young goat is called a kid.

If a patient over the age of 50 presents with shoulder-and pelvic-girdle muscle pain, and you suspect a diagnosis of Polymyalgia Rheumatica, what question should you ask to rule out another diagnosis which often accompanies this one?

options.text: Do you get short of breath?
Does your jaw hurt when you chew?
Does it ever seem that your heart is beating fast?
Do you have tingling in your feet or toes?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Does your jaw hurt when you chew?

questions.question: All of the following medications are contraindicated during pregnancy, EXCEPT which one?
What is the national flower of Wales?
If Kermit the Frog were a live animal, would he be considered an amphibian?
Nag is slang for what animal?
When a patient presents with a sore throat, which of the following diagnoses may indicate immediate intubation?
What continent is the aardvark native to?
Identify a true characteristic of skeletal muscle.

options.text: It is found in the stomach and intestines.
It is non-striated, composed of spindle shaped cells.
It is striated, made up of long slender, striped cells.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is striated, made up of long slender, striped cells.

questions.question: What sea creature has 3 hearts and 8 tentacles?
What does a koala eat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: eucalyptus leaves

questions.question: What does a caterpillar turn into?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: butterfly or moth

questions.question: What continent are tigers native to?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Following and Asthma
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, vinegar, seizures. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following is a possible cause of sudden-onset shortness of breath?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both of these

questions.question: Which of the following patients should have the lowest goal low-density lipoprotein?

options.text: A 60-year-old man with erectile dysfunction and a family history of coronary artery disease
A 50-year-old cigarette-smoking woman with familial hypercholesterolemia

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A 30-year-old woman with type 2 diabetes

questions.question: All of the following are common causes of elevated liver enzymes EXCEPT which one?
Name the first four planets of the Solar System in order of their distance from the Sun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars

questions.question: What is the largest planet in the solar system?
Which of the following opiates is most likely to cause seizures?
Which of the following tests would be appropriate to confirm the diagnosis of B12 deficiency in a patient whose B12 level is at the low end of the normal range?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Methylmalonic Acid level

questions.question: What is the chemical formula for baking soda?
All of the following are treatments for rheumatoid arthritis EXCEPT which one?
Which of these is represented by the chemical formula C12 H22 O11?
It is certainly feasible to practice medicine without ever prescribing opiate medications.
Mixing baking soda and vinegar in a closed container causes a tiny explosion.
Which of the following is INCORRECT?

options.text: Esophoria need not be addressed before the age of 3.
Umbilical hernias almost always resolve spontaneously by the age of 5.
Acute otitis media in a child need not be treated with an antibiotic.
In epispadias the urethral meatus is superior to its normal location.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Esophoria need not be addressed before the age of 3.

questions.question: Treatment of asthma with a long-acting beta agonist is inadvisable unless you are also treating the asthma with a steroid.
What is the atomic number of the chemical element chlorine?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Church and Constantinople
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, field, example. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The long body of the church Hagia Irene in Istanbul (former Constantinople) is covered by two domes.
The first examples of early Byzantine architecture, found in Ravenna and Constantinople, date from the reign of which Byzantine emperor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Justinian I

questions.question: Almost all organisms on Earth have a vision restricted to small range of the electromagnetic spectrum (between 320 and 800 nm). This is considered to be a consequence of which of these evolutionary facts?

options.text: The atmosphere had different composition when life emerged
At the time when life emerged, the electromagnetic spectrum was different

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Life emerged underwater

questions.question: The name of which country is derived from the Latin word for silver?
Unlike most animals eyes, the eyes of fish and snakes usually have a fixed lens size. How do these animals eyes focus then?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By telescoping the lens

questions.question: St Volodimyr Cathedral, an example of Neo-Byzantine architecture, is located in which Eastern European city?
Elmali Kilise, a rock sanctuary built in Byzantine style, dates back to the Comnenan period and is located in which district?
What is the maximum angle of field of vision compound eyes can have?
The Church of the Holy Sepulchre, also called the Church of the Resurrection, is an example of Byzantine architecture, located in which city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerusalem, Israel

questions.question: The church of Hagia Irene, a Byzantine church, was converted into a mosque by Sultan Mehmed the Conquerer.
St Marks Basilica, a prominent example of Byzantine architecture, is located in which Italian city?
The Byzantine church of Hagia Irene was the seat of the Bishop of Constantinople until what year?
The dome of Hagia Sophia in Istanbul (former Constantinople) is supported by how many massive piers?
Which of these species has the most complex color vision known?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Mantis shrimp

questions.question: What star is closest to the sun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Proxima Centauri

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Eyes and Metric System
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, field, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What unit is used in the metric system for measuring time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the second

questions.question: In the metric system, what unit is used to measure temperature?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: degrees Kelvin

questions.question: What does the metric prefix nano mean?
In order to achieve the widest possible field of view, these animals have their two eyes positioned on opposite sides of their heads.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prey animals

questions.question: Which three nations have not officially adopted the metric system?

options.text: The USA, the United Kingdom, Malawi

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The USA, Liberia, Myanmar

questions.question: Chameleons have some of the most distinctive eyes among the reptiles. The two separately moving and focusing eyes of a chameleon give it a full 360-degree arc of vision around its body, but can they also ensure sharp clear focusing on one single object?
Who was the first person to propose the idea of a metric system?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Simon Stevin

questions.question: What does the metric prefix kilo mean?
Which of these activities can cause permanent damage to the eyes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: Many computer drives have a capacity of a terabit. How many bits are in one terabit?
What does the  prefix milli mean?
Iridology is a branch of ophthalmology that deals with diseases and treatment of the human iris.
Stereopsis is a process in visual perception giving the organism a sensation of what?
Which was the first nation to adopt a metric system?
If compared to a camera, what part of the human eye is its aperture?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Acid and Base
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, yottagram, reaction. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which two of these are produced when an acid and a base are mixed together?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: water and a salt

questions.question: When did the Nintendo system debut in the U.S.A.?
What is the reaction called when an acid and a base are mixed together?
HCl has pH close to which one of these?
This engineer, called the father of supercomputing, has been credited with creating the supercomputer industry.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seymour Gray

questions.question: The Kasson Metric Act of 1866 made the Metric System the official system of the USA, although it was repealed in 1873.
What happens to an indicator when touched by an acid or a base?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the color changes

questions.question: The giant sub atomic particle collider, capable of reproducing the big bang conditions, is located in which research facility?
There is a unit called a Yottagram. How many grams are in one Yottagram?
Bases corrode metal.
Which nation issued the first metric currency - a unit that was divided in 100 parts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The USA

questions.question: Thomas Jefferson was a leading opponent of the metric system.
What does XML stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: extensible markup language

questions.question: If HCl and NaOH are combined, what compound is produced other than water?
Why did the U.S.A. launch the Galileo space probe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: to explore Jupiter

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Solar System and Abbreviation
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, reaction, abbreviation. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The pH of solids in solid form can be measured using indicator paper.
Which statement is true about airplanes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To dive, elevators are down.

questions.question: Why are recoilless guns recoilless?

options.text: Their barrels are open at both ends.
They are loaded with missiles not cannon balls.
They are made of  very heavy metals.
They are not placed on wheels.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Their barrels are open at both ends.

questions.question: What is an endothermic chemical reaction?

options.text: A chemical reaction in which energy is released
A chemical reaction in which energy is used up
A chemical reaction in which oxides are produced
A chemical reaction in which carbon compounds are involved

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A chemical reaction in which energy is used up

questions.question: Taxonomy of vertebrates divides fishes into what two basic groups?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jawed and jawless

questions.question: What is the range of the pH scale?
Which of these values signifies the greatest temperature?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One degree Celsius

questions.question: What is soap?

options.text: an acid with a sour taste
an acid with a bitter taste
a base with a sour taste
a base with a bitter taste

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a base with a bitter taste

questions.question: A ionic compound with H (hydrogen) in the front is most likely to be which of the following?
Approximately how long is one astronomical unit (1 a.u.)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 149,597,000 km/ 92,955,266 miles

questions.question: What is the name of the Galaxy that our Solar System is a part of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Milky Way

questions.question: What makes almost 99% of the visible universe?
Fill in the missing letter in this chain that has to do with the Solar System we live in: M, V, E, M, J, _, U, N.
What does the abbreviation THEL stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tactical high energy laser

questions.question: “Wattle and daub is a method of construction.
